trans-unit.source: Operations on DocumentDB Attachments
trans-unit.target: Operations on DocumentDB Attachments

trans-unit.source: The DocumentDB API supports basic CRUD operations on the resources under a database account.
trans-unit.target: The DocumentDB API supports basic CRUD operations on the resources under a database account.

trans-unit.source: This topic outlines the REST operations used to manage DocumentDB attachments.
trans-unit.target: This topic outlines the REST operations used to manage DocumentDB attachments.

trans-unit.source: Attachments are special documents that contain references and associated metadata with an external blob or media file.
trans-unit.target: Attachments are special documents that contain references and associated metadata with an external blob or media file.

trans-unit.source: Developers can choose to have:
trans-unit.target: Developers can choose to have:

trans-unit.source: The attachment media/blob managed by DocumentDB or
trans-unit.target: The attachment media/blob managed by DocumentDB or

trans-unit.source: Store it with an external blob service provider such as OneDrive, Dropbox, etc. and store the reference metadata for attachment in DocumentDB.
trans-unit.target: Store it with an external blob service provider such as OneDrive, Dropbox, etc. and store the reference metadata for attachment in DocumentDB.

trans-unit.source: Attachments are a preview feature in DocumentDB and has small limits for experimentation and development.
trans-unit.target: Attachments are a preview feature in DocumentDB and has small limits for experimentation and development.

trans-unit.source: For attachment storage quota information, see <externalLink><linkText>DocumentDB limits</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/documentdb-limits/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For attachment storage quota information, see <externalLink><linkText>DocumentDB limits</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/documentdb-limits/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The attachment resource is represented by <legacyItalic><legacyBold>attachments</legacyBold></legacyItalic> in the <externalLink><linkText>DocumentDB REST resource model</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/documentdb-resources/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: The attachment resource is represented by <legacyItalic><legacyBold>attachments</legacyBold></legacyItalic> in the <externalLink><linkText>DocumentDB REST resource model</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/documentdb-resources/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The attachment resource has a fixed schema.
trans-unit.target: The attachment resource has a fixed schema.

trans-unit.source: Regardless of where the raw media is stored, the following properties are required.
trans-unit.target: Regardless of where the raw media is stored, the following properties are required.

trans-unit.source: The following example illustrates the JSON construct of a document attachment.
trans-unit.target: The following example illustrates the JSON construct of a document attachment.

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: id
trans-unit.target: id

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: This is a user settable property.
trans-unit.target: This is a user settable property.

trans-unit.source: It is the unique name that identifies the attachment, i.e. no two attachments share the same <legacyBold>id</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: It is the unique name that identifies the attachment, i.e. no two attachments share the same <legacyBold>id</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: The <legacyBold>id</legacyBold> must not exceed 255 characters.
trans-unit.target: The <legacyBold>id</legacyBold> must not exceed 255 characters.

trans-unit.source: contentType
trans-unit.target: contentType

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: This is a user settable property.
trans-unit.target: This is a user settable property.

trans-unit.source: It specifies the content type of the attachment.
trans-unit.target: It specifies the content type of the attachment.

trans-unit.source: When submitting the attachment bits as the body, DocumentDB sets the <legacyBold>contentType</legacyBold> to the type set in the <legacyBold>Content-Type</legacyBold> header.
trans-unit.target: When submitting the attachment bits as the body, DocumentDB sets the <legacyBold>contentType</legacyBold> to the type set in the <legacyBold>Content-Type</legacyBold> header.

trans-unit.source: Media
trans-unit.target: Media

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: This is the URL link or file path where the attachment resides.
trans-unit.target: This is the URL link or file path where the attachment resides.

trans-unit.source: _rid
trans-unit.target: _rid

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property.

trans-unit.source: The resource ID (_rid) is a unique identifier that is also hierarchical per the resource stack on the resource model.
trans-unit.target: The resource ID (_rid) is a unique identifier that is also hierarchical per the resource stack on the resource model.

trans-unit.source: It is used internally for placement and navigation of the attachment resource.
trans-unit.target: It is used internally for placement and navigation of the attachment resource.

trans-unit.source: _ts
trans-unit.target: _ts

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property.

trans-unit.source: It specifies the last updated timestamp of the resource.
trans-unit.target: It specifies the last updated timestamp of the resource.

trans-unit.source: The value is a timestamp.
trans-unit.target: The value is a timestamp.

trans-unit.source: _self
trans-unit.target: _self

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property.

trans-unit.source: It is the unique addressable URI for the resource.
trans-unit.target: It is the unique addressable URI for the resource.

trans-unit.source: _etag
trans-unit.target: _etag

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property that specifies the resource etag required for optimistic concurrency control.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property that specifies the resource etag required for optimistic concurrency control.

trans-unit.source: The following are the allowable operation on attachments.
trans-unit.target: The following are the allowable operation on attachments.

trans-unit.source: Replace an attachment
trans-unit.target: Replace an attachment

trans-unit.source: List attachments
trans-unit.target: List attachments

trans-unit.source: Delete attachments
trans-unit.target: Delete attachments

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="62b49c14-9355-4469-b67a-2c1fbcdb18b4" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Querying DocumentDB Resources</link>.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="62b49c14-9355-4469-b67a-2c1fbcdb18b4" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Querying DocumentDB Resources</link>.

trans-unit.source: Note that the attachment content is not indexed or searchable; the attachment resource properties are indexed and searchable.
trans-unit.target: Note that the attachment content is not indexed or searchable; the attachment resource properties are indexed and searchable.

trans-unit.source: These operations are similar to the ones for documents.
trans-unit.target: These operations are similar to the ones for documents.

trans-unit.source: Instead of performing the operations against the <legacyItalic><legacyBold>docs</legacyBold></legacyItalic>, they are preformed against the <legacyItalic><legacyBold>attachments</legacyBold></legacyItalic> resource path under a particular document.
trans-unit.target: Instead of performing the operations against the <legacyItalic><legacyBold>docs</legacyBold></legacyItalic>, they are preformed against the <legacyItalic><legacyBold>attachments</legacyBold></legacyItalic> resource path under a particular document.

trans-unit.source: Hence, we will skip elaborating each of the operations.
trans-unit.target: Hence, we will skip elaborating each of the operations.

trans-unit.source: Instead, in the next section, we will discuss how to create an attachment with raw media posting and with metadata-only posting.
trans-unit.target: Instead, in the next section, we will discuss how to create an attachment with raw media posting and with metadata-only posting.
